page.title: 03RIBCHESTER TODAY.
page.content: The encroachment of the{River Ribble has guaranteed that remains of the Roman fort have been exposed at regular intervals,maintaining the public's interest.In 79A.D.Ribchester stood at the junction of the Roman Road from Manchester via Carlisle to Scotland and the route from York to a West Coast base near Fleetwood.Today it stands at the crossroads of the old and the new. Since the{Museum}opened in 1914 thousands of visitors have looked at the village's Roman past and many more enjoyed an attractive little place with an interesting Church,many old buildings built with stone pillaged from the Roman fort,a thriving woollen mill selling cloth and ready made goods and pleasant pubs serving home made food and good locally brewed ale.
